TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , LOC .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's father died in a fire . The applicant alleged that the death had been caused by the firemen 's manifest failure to comply with the fire - fighting instructions . In DATE PERSON , an investigator of ORG of ORG , reported to a local prosecutor about the incident . In his official explanatory note issued in reply to the prosecutor 's inquiry PERSON stated that the applicant 's repeated unfounded complaints demonstrated that she must have been suffering from some mental disorder and that he strongly recommended subjecting her to a psychiatric examination .
CARDINAL . The applicant sued PERSON and ORG of LOC for defamation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found in the applicant 's favour . The court held , in particular , that PERSON had acted in his official capacity of an investigator when making the defamatory statements about the applicant . The court awarded her MONEY ( RUB ) in nonpecuniary damages against ORG of LOC and ordered PERSON to retract the false information about the applicant . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment in substance , and it entered into force . The judgment has not been executed to date .

CARDINAL . On DATE pursuant to order no . CARDINAL of DATE issued by ORG of GPE , ORG of LOC was liquidated by way of removal from the ORG tax register . The functions of ORG have since been executed by the previously existing ORG of ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL writs of execution issued by ORG on DATE were received by the bailiff service of GPE , which initiated the enforcement proceedings on DATE . In the course of the proceedings the bailiff service established that the judgment could not be enforced due to the debtor 's liquidation . On DATE ORG of PERSON terminated the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG refused to replace the respondent authority by ORG of GPE on the ground that the latter was not a legal successor to the defunct ORG . The judgment was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant further sued ORG for damages resulting from the firemen 's negligence . On DATE ORG in the final instance rejected her complaints as unfounded .
CARDINAL . NORP Under section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment in DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment in DATE .
